intro: Linzia glabra var. laxa, commonly known as the slender linseed plant, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive bracts and often edible seeds. The species is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. This plant thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as prairies and disturbed areas.
